New Records: The White Sox remain tied with the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in one season with 120 losses
Key Match Events: The White Sox defeated the Angels 7-0 with 6 innings of pitching from Chris Flexen and a season-high seven-run inning
Pre-Game Insights: The White Sox needed to sweep the playoff-hunting Tigers this weekend to avoid owning the record by themselves
Post-Match Reflections: The team's ability to avoid giving in to the record was highlighted
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox will need to sweep the Tigers to avoid the record, an improbable task
